data.title: Paul Merage School of Business
data.text:
First Place: Sentinel: A platform that can save lives by using AI to detect trucker drowsiness/distraction and keeping them alert.

Second Place: Bagit: Aims to simplify access to savings on products & services for students/consumers by centralizing relevant on-demand discounts in one place. BagIt further facilitates partnerships between merchants and students/consumers, enhancing shopping experiences through streamlined transactions.

First Place: Flare: FLARE is a safety glove and mobile app combination that addresses the dangerous miscommunication gap between riders, walkers, and cars by alerting others to the rider’s presence using signals, lights, sounds and gestures while also protecting users in the case of a collision.

Second Place: Lynne: The seamless bundle between an app and wallet to empower women to take control of their lives by taking control of their birth control in a functional, fashionable, and affordable way.

First Place: Quiver: Our all-you-can-surf board subscription empowers surfers who want to ride a wide variety of surfboards by offering infinite board selection at our brick-and-mortar board libraries and transforming surfers’ relationship to the sport they love.

Second Place: Crafty Palate: Craving unique, high-quality local food? Crafty Palate connects you directly with passionate artisans selling their homemade goodies online, making it easier than ever to discover and support your community's finest.

First Place: Two Cube: A platform that offers fully autonomous bioinformatics analysis and research agents. It streamlines single-cell RNA analysis pipelines, enabling automatic code generation, result interpretation, and hypothesis development, empowering users to advance their scientific inquiries with ease.

Second Place: NeoMold: A customizable, 3D-printed ear mold that non-surgically corrects newborn outer ear deformities within 2-6 weeks of birth with reduced complications and patient readmittance rates.

First Place: PZ Nanopure: Blue energy, which harnesses clean power from saltwater, faces efficiency and cost hurdles. PZ Nanopure's piezoelectric nanopore membranes aim to unlock blue energy's full potential, driving down energy costs and accelerating the path to net zero.

Second Place: DermaVision: DermaVision is a forensic imaging tool capable of detecting bruising across dark and light skin tones, while also providing quantitative estimations of the time of injury.

Team Rules

The UCI Stella Zhang New Venture Competition is open to every UCI graduate and undergraduate student. Affiliation with the business school is not required.

To submit a concept paper, there is no team requirement, however, once teams make it to the Board Room Pitch phase, you will be required to have a minimum number of 4 people and maximum of 6 people on your team and at least 2 team members must be UCI students.

At least 2 team members must be enrolled students at UCI. A registered student is defined as a bona fide student registered at UCI for at least two quarters during the 23-24 academic year.

Recommendations

Developing a robust and multi-talented team is essential to any new venture. Success in the Stella Zhang New Venture Competition is no different. Reach beyond your classmates to form a team of many strengths and talents from across campus.

Don’t forget that only 2 team members must be enrolled at UCI. Consider recruiting UCI faculty, staff, alumni, and others to your team!

View Complete Eligibility Requirements, Rules & Application Details

Teams must present an original idea for a venture which may not have been in existence for more than two years.

Note: Practice makes perfect. Teams who competed last year (but did not win a prize) can compete with the same idea this year. However, teams who won last year will not be able to compete with the same idea.

Teams must be in pre-incubator form and must not have received financial backing by professional third-party accelerators, incubators, existing companies, or venture capitalists in an amount greater than $10,000.

All business concepts must be created by the participant/team who has registered for the competition.

View Complete Eligibility Requirements, Rules & Application Details

New ventures have unique considerations based on the business type. This has a direct impact on business formation and other early-stage considerations.

Teams compete in 1 of 5 tracks. The Stella Zhang New Venture Competition programming addresses unique considerations for each track. Teams also benefit by working with industry mentors and judges familiar with their type of business.

The first and second-place teams in each track at the Semi-Final Board Room round will receive a cash prize. They will then advance to compete in the Grand Finale for a grand prize to be announced. Additional specialty prizes may be announced as well.

All finalists will be receiving AWS (Amazon Web Services) credit to use to create their websites.

11/14/2023 - Workshop 1: How to Come up with a Billion Dollar Idea + Mixer

01/16/2024 - Workshop 2: Form Your Winning Team & Rules + Mixer

01/23/2024 - Workshop 3: From Idea to Business + Mixer

01/30/2024 - Workshop 4: How to Research Your Market + Mixer

02/12/2024 - Workshop 5: How to Write a Winning Concept Paper + Mixer

02/20/2024 - Workshop 6: Designing Your Concept Paper

04/09/2024 - Workshop 7: How to Build a Winning Pitch Deck + Mixer

04/16/2024 - Workshop 8: How to Go to Market + Mixer

04/23/2024 - Workshop 9: How to Make Money + Mixer

04/30/2024 - Workshop 10: How to Pitch & Deal With Q&A + Mixer

Workshops 1 – 4 prepare teams to submit a 3-page concept paper, a document similar to an executive summary. Judges score the papers to determine the semi-finalists who will advance to the next round.

Concept papers are due by 11:59 p.m. on Sunday, March 10, 2024.

Concept Paper Samples:

Business Products and Services

Sample 1

Sample 2

Consumer Products

Sample 1

Sample 2

Consumer Services

Sample 1

Sample 2

Life Science

Sample 1

Sample 2

Social Enterprise

Sample 1

Sample 2

Semi-finalists will continue to develop their business concept. Semi-finalists will prepare a pitch deck and present it to a panel of judges. The Semi-Final Presentations will take place on May 10, 2024.

Teams present for 10 minutes followed by a 10-minute Q & A session. Using a five-point scale, judges will grade team presentations.

The highest-scoring teams within each of the 5 tracks will receive awards. Additional awards may also be announced.

Please consider the Judges Criteria when creating your pitch decks:

Business Products Services Judging Rubric

Consumer Products Judging Rubric

Consumer Services Judging Rubric

Life Sciences Judging Rubric

Social Enterprise Judging Rubric

(Note: Criteria may be updated at any time. If the judging criteria are updated, they will be sent to the teams prior to the pitch dates.)

Returning this year is the exciting Grand Finale challenge! Teams who win first and second place in their tracks will not only walk away with their share of the prize money—but they will also compete head-to-head in a LIVE Shark-Tank-inspired quick-pitch for our Grand Finale! Teams who can WOW our judges and the audience in a quick 3-minute pitch with a 5-minute Q&A from our esteemed judge panel will have the opportunity to win more prize money. Stay tuned for more information and updates.
